title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 22 January 2016 - XWiki

10:34 <vmassol> Enygma`: hi. I've tried to improve the doc at http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki80M1#HUpgrades let me know if it's ok and if I've understood it correctly. FTR I don't like that we reference jira issues in releases notes (or in code FWIW) as I consider the issue tracker a transient resource that can go away at any time. I prefer that our doc be self sustaining.  
10:34 <vmassol> do you agree?  
10:35 <vmassol> BTW I think this should be added to the doc proper too  
10:39 <msmeria> has quit  
10:41 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <vmassol> Enygma`: I've commented on the jira issue  
10:42 <vmassol> it should not be documented actually  
10:42 <vmassol> and no jira issue should have been created

15:53 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
16:00 <vmassol> ClemensR: Hi  
16:01 <ClemensR> Hi vmassol!  
16:01 <vmassol> you should probably use https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-dependency-plugin/go-offline-mojo.html instead  
16:02 <vmassol> (for your doc at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/FillLocalMavenRepository)  
16:02 <ClemensR> ah, I didnt use it, not really, was just wondering for that guy who has troubel installing the ui on the mailing list  
16:02 <vmassol> making the build fail is not very nice and this should avoid any build failure  
16:03 <ClemensR> ah, but it could make the stuff look less than a hack, maybe  
16:03 <ClemensR> it fails only in the validators, because the developers are not set up ... not due to dependencies  
16:04 <vmassol> it fails because you call install  
16:04 <vmassol> if you call the depdnency plugin it shouldn't fail  
16:04 <ClemensR> ah, yes, or that  
16:07 <ClemensR> tested and it works, thanks!  
16:07 <vmassol> cool  
16:26 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:39 <vmassol> has quit  
17:40 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:54 <vmassol> has quit  
17:57 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:04 <Pbas1> Hi may I a quick question before the week end (if someone left) :-) ?  
18:04 <Pbas1> On my web site, I want to get some external json data from another web site (provided on http without authenticate).  
18:04 <Pbas1> Which way I have to import simple json data from external site or read it?  
18:04 <Pbas1> A nice API to read external http data?  
18:13 <vmassol> hi Pbas1  
18:13 <Pbas1> Hi :)  
18:15 <vmassol> you could check http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Include+External+Content  
18:15 <Pbas1> Ok thxs  
18:15 <vmassol> if you need to parse the json then you could use groovy, the download + parsing can be done in 1 line  
18:15 <Pbas1> how do you do?  
18:15 <vmassol> there are examples on e.x.o too  
18:16 <vmassol> I'm fine thanks  
18:16 <vmassol> trying hard to fix your jira issue about the pdf export  
18:16 <Pbas1> I can parse with velocity too isn't it?  
18:16 <vmassol> :)  
18:16 <vmassol> yes you can too using $jsontool  
18:16 <Pbas1> yes I saw that  
18:17 <Pbas1> it seem a complicated issue  
18:18 <Pbas1> wow one line witth groovy ... thinking ... I must make an effort  
18:21 <Pbas1> ... or not (I want to use it on myxwiki.org) without PR  
18:21 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:31 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
18:39 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:43 <Pbas1> ok then have a nice week end bye :)  
18:43 <vmassol> thx  
18:43 <vmassol> u2  
18:43 <Pbas1> thxs
